intro: Cypella osteniana subsp. aurantiaca, commonly known as the yellow cypella, is a flowering plant native to the southern regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
